head.title: Ms. Le Winter And Mr. Seliger

hedline.hl1: Ms. Le Winter And Mr. Seliger

block.p: Andrea Hope Le Winter, a daughter of Dr. Barbara W. Le Winter and Dr. Martin M. Le Winter of South Burlington, Vt., is to be married today to Dr. Stephen Lev Seliger, the son of Joen Seliger and Dr. Gustav Seliger of New York. Rabbi Michael M. Cohen is to officiate at the Wilburton Inn in Manchester, Vt.
The couple graduated from Columbia University.

Andrea Hope Le Winter, a daughter of Dr. Barbara W. Le Winter and Dr. Martin M. Le Winter of South Burlington, Vt., is to be married today to Dr. Stephen Lev Seliger, the son of Joen Seliger and Dr. Gustav Seliger of New York. Rabbi Michael M. Cohen is to officiate at the Wilburton Inn in Manchester, Vt.
The couple graduated from Columbia University.

Ms. Le Winter, 27, will keep her name. She is to begin her third year at New York University School of Law later this month. She received a master's degree in public policy from Harvard University. Her father is the director of the cardiology unit at the hospital of the University of Vermont in Burlington and a professor at the university's College of Medicine. Her mother is the school psychologist for the public school district in Essex Junction, Vt.

Dr. Seliger, 28, is a third-year resident in internal medicine at New York Presbyterian Hospital in New York. He received his medical degree with honors from N.Y.U. His mother retired as a child development consultant at the Hall Mercer-Mental Health and Retardation Center of Pennsylvania Hospital in Philadelphia. His father, a retired radiologist, practiced in Philadelphia.
